author: Staff Reporter
text:
Printers in Madurai district were instructed to follow all election-related regulations during a meeting convened by Collector and Election Officer K. Veera Raghava Rao here on Tuesday.

Pointing out the provisions of the Representation of the People Act, Mr. Rao told the printers on the importance of printing the name and address of both the printer and the publisher while printing posters, pamphlets or other campaign materials for elections.

He also asked the printers to get the appropriate forms signed by the publisher and submit them within three days to the District Election Office along with samples of the printed materials and the total cost.

The cost will be included to the election expenditure of the candidate concerned.

If no election-related materials were getting printed, the printers were asked to inform the same to the District Election Office in appropriate format every week.

The printers were also asked to ensure that the content getting printed was not offensive and in compliance with the Model Code of Conduct.

SVEEP campaign

As part of the ongoing Systematic Voters’ Education and Electoral Participation (SVEEP) campaigns being conducted across the district to create awareness of the importance of voting, a human chain formation was done at Madurai Apollo College of Nursing at Valayangulam in Tiruparankundram constituency on Tuesday.

Mr. Rao, Additional Collector and Project Officer (District Rural Development Agency) B. Rohini Ramdas and other officials participated in the campaign along with students and staff of the college.
title: Printers urged to follow election regulations
